title: sporeg Intended Workflow

Let’s begin clearing environment. clearing cache may remaining previous work. Next, let’s load packages need run steps vignette.

what: Get the objects required for re-routing tracks
title: sporeg Intended Workflow
text: Get land barrier. Create visibility graph land barrier object.
code: vis_graph <- pathroutr::prt_visgraph(land_barrier)

title: sporeg Intended Workflow
text: simulating tracks: iterations:
code: # Number of animals anims <- 3 # Number of years yr <- 1        # Turning angle - standard deviation of body flexion from blacktip kinematics study theta <- c(0, 1.74)   # Lower bound of mean recorded velocity for animal in m/s (ex: blacktip shark) (average - standard deviation) vmin <- 0.98   # Upper bound of mean recorded velocity for animal in m/s (ex: blacktip shark) (average + standard deviation) vmax <- 1.58   # Intersection of bounding box of release site(s) and study site rel_site <- rel_site   # Study site must be an sp object for the track simulations study_site <- study_site   # Name the epsg of the coordinate system for study_site crs <- 3857  # Number of days animal is tracked n_days <- 365*yr  # Initial heading of animal initHeading <- 0 total_iterations <- 2 # Total number of iterations desired reps <- 2 # Number of replicates that will result in desired iterations given reps runs <- 1:(total_iterations/reps) # Interval at which outputs should be written to file

title: sporeg Intended Workflow
text: allow us run processes parallel. , find many cores , including logical cores, create cluster Creating cluster create multiple instances R computer. Now, need upload libraries R instance need run iterations. Notice omitted parallel library. Let’s create output file results go. want create file , otherwise overwrite previous results. Thus, need un-comment lines create first time. want assign file name every time run iterations, however. Let’s remove unnecessary objects may created load environment cluster Now ’re ready mirror global environment cluster cores.
code: numCores <- detectCores(logical = F) numCores  cl <- makeCluster(numCores-4, outfile = "cluster_out") clusterEvalQ(cl, {      library(sporeg)   library(sf)   library(sp)   library(glatos)    library(dplyr)   library(momentuHMM)   library(crawl)   library(lubridate)   library(pathroutr)   library(sfnetworks)   library(tidyverse)   library(stplanr)   library(future)   library(doFuture)    }) # Create empty list object and save it # results <- list()  # Assign the filename filename <- "results.Rda"  # Save the empty list object to the filename # save(results, file = filename) rm(list = c("HS_100km_grid", "HS_50km_grid", "HS_25km_grid", "HS_10km_grid")) parallel::clusterExport(cl, varlist = ls(envir = .GlobalEnv))

title: sporeg Intended Workflow
text: now everything place iterate methods. , using base::replicate decide often save iterations made. using parallel::parLapply create iterations. , decided use reps <- 10 runs <- 100, create 1,000 total iterations save every 100 iterations.
code: base::replicate(n = reps, expr = {          iterated_results <- parallel::parLapply(cl, runs, fun = function(I) {              # Simulate tracks        df <- simul_trks(anims, study_site, theta, vmin, vmax, rel_site, crs, n_days, initHeading)              # Compare summary distribution info of simulated and modeled tracks across multiple grid cell resolutions       df <- comp_trks(df, stations, land_barrier, vis_graph, HSgrid, multi.grid = TRUE, snap_tolerance = 650)              return(df)     }     )     # Load the previous results     load(system.file("extdata", filename, package = "sporeg"))           # Append the new results to the previous results     results <- append(results, iterated_results)          # Overwrite the results with both the new and previous results combined     save(results, file = system.file("extdata", filename, package = "sporeg"))         return(df)   }   )

title: sporeg Intended Workflow
text: always want stop cluster finished using .
code: parallel::stopCluster(cl)

title: sporeg Intended Workflow
text: number iterations want depends variable results let’s power analysis ’ve run hundred iterations. First, let’s load results. Hmm… hard look . Let’s turn data frame instead.
code: load(system.file("extdata", filename, package = "sporeg")) # Bind the lists by grid cell resolution results <- lapply(results, data.table::rbindlist, idcol = 'resolution')  # Bind the bound resolution by iteration results <- data.table::rbindlist(results, idcol = 'iteration')

title: sporeg Intended Workflow
text: Remove cases sim_count mod_count zero iterations within grid resolution. First, let’s merge grid resolution size names main data frame. Test zero variance.
code: results <- results %>%   dplyr::left_join(dplyr::tibble(resolution = 1:4,                     res_name = c("100km", "50km", "25km", "10km")),              by = "resolution") # Remove grid cells with zero variance df_var <- zero_var(results)   # Find the grid cell with zero variance df_zero_var <- anti_join(results, df_var, by = c("res_name", "gid")) %>%   distinct(res_name, gid)

title: sporeg Intended Workflow
text: Prep results power analysis setting parameters power analysis. previously set number animals, ’s likely ’ve stepped away work things iterations finished can run un-commenting anims <- 30 need . Whatever variable interested , set NULL. , want know many iterations need achieve power 80% effect size within 1% total number animals 95% significance level, leave n <- NULL. parameters power, delta, sig.level, n need chosen based study . past, statistics book served useful resource . also comes R code resources.  Let’s calculate standard deviation grid resolution. Now ’re ready run power analysis. need run one grid cell resolution. , ’ll setting another variable called res filtering grid cell resolution interest results prepped power analysis.
code: # The number of animals anims <- anims  # The power that we want to achieve power <- 0.8  # The effect size we want to achieve delta <- anims*0.01 # a delta within 1% of the total number of animals  # The level of significance that we want to achieve sig.level <- 0.95  # The number of iterations we will need to run to achieve the other parameters that we set n <- NULL pow_stat <- df_var %>%    group_by(res_name, gid) %>%   summarise(sd = sd(dif)) %>%   ungroup() %>%   group_by(res_name) #> `summarise()` has grouped output by 'res_name'. You can override using the #> `.groups` argument.  res <- pow_stat %>% dplyr::filter(res_name == "100km") pwr_100km <- powr(res, sig.level, power, delta) print("Grid cell resolution: 100 km x 100 km") #> [1] "Grid cell resolution: 100 km x 100 km" pwr_100km #>  #>      Paired t test power calculation  #>  #>               n = 11837.53 #>           delta = 0.03 #>              sd = 3.609324 #>       sig.level = 0.95 #>           power = 0.8 #>     alternative = two.sided #>  #> NOTE: n is number of *pairs*, sd is std.dev. of *differences* within pairs  res <- pow_stat %>% dplyr::filter(res_name == "50km") pwr_50km <- powr(res, sig.level, power, delta) print("Grid cell resolution: 50 km x 50 km") #> [1] "Grid cell resolution: 50 km x 50 km" pwr_50km #>  #>      Paired t test power calculation  #>  #>               n = 12784.14 #>           delta = 0.03 #>              sd = 3.750861 #>       sig.level = 0.95 #>           power = 0.8 #>     alternative = two.sided #>  #> NOTE: n is number of *pairs*, sd is std.dev. of *differences* within pairs  res <- pow_stat %>% dplyr::filter(res_name == "25km") pwr_25km <- powr(res, sig.level, power, delta) print("Grid cell resolution: 25 km x 25 km") #> [1] "Grid cell resolution: 25 km x 25 km" pwr_25km #>  #>      Paired t test power calculation  #>  #>               n = 12784.14 #>           delta = 0.03 #>              sd = 3.750861 #>       sig.level = 0.95 #>           power = 0.8 #>     alternative = two.sided #>  #> NOTE: n is number of *pairs*, sd is std.dev. of *differences* within pairs   res <- pow_stat %>% dplyr::filter(res_name == "10km") pwr_10km <- powr(res, sig.level, power, delta) print("Grid cell resolution: 10 km x 10 km") #> [1] "Grid cell resolution: 10 km x 10 km" pwr_10km #>  #>      Paired t test power calculation  #>  #>               n = 14404.71 #>           delta = 0.03 #>              sd = 3.981507 #>       sig.level = 0.95 #>           power = 0.8 #>     alternative = two.sided #>  #> NOTE: n is number of *pairs*, sd is std.dev. of *differences* within pairs

title: sporeg Intended Workflow

code: max_sd <- pow_stat %>%   ungroup() %>%   group_by(res_name) %>%   summarise(max_sd = max(sd)) max_sd #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   res_name max_sd #>   <chr>     <dbl> #> 1 100km      3.61 #> 2 10km       3.98 #> 3 25km       3.75 #> 4 50km       3.75

title: sporeg Intended Workflow
text: Let’s create table shows closely modeled tracks compared reconstructed tracks grid resolution. , compare counts grid cells within certain difference sim_count divided total number grid cells.
code: # Counts how_well_ct <- results %>%   mutate(res_name = ordered(res_name, levels = c("100km", "50km", "25km", "10km")),          wn_0 = ifelse(avg_dif >= -1*0.3 & avg_dif <= 0.3, 1, 0),          wn_1 = ifelse(avg_dif >= -1*1 & avg_dif <= 1, 1, 0),           wn_2 = ifelse(avg_dif >= -1*2 & avg_dif <= 2, 1, 0),           wn_3 = ifelse(avg_dif >= -1*3 & avg_dif <= 3, 1, 0),           wn_4 = ifelse(avg_dif >= -1*4 & avg_dif <= 4, 1, 0),           wn_5 = ifelse(avg_dif >= -1*5 & avg_dif <= 5, 1, 0)) %>%     group_by(res_name) %>%   summarise(maxgid = n(),             tot_wn_0 = sum(wn_0),             tot_wn_1 = sum(wn_1),             tot_wn_2 = sum(wn_2),             tot_wn_3 = sum(wn_3),             tot_wn_4 = sum(wn_4),             tot_wn_5 = sum(wn_5)) %>%   distinct()  # Percentages how_well <- results %>%   mutate(res_name = ordered(res_name, levels = c("100km", "50km", "25km", "10km")),          wn_0 = ifelse(avg_dif >= -1*0.3 & avg_dif <= 0.3, 1, 0),          wn_1 = ifelse(avg_dif >= -1*1 & avg_dif <= 1, 1, 0),           wn_2 = ifelse(avg_dif >= -1*2 & avg_dif <= 2, 1, 0),           wn_3 = ifelse(avg_dif >= -1*3 & avg_dif <= 3, 1, 0),           wn_4 = ifelse(avg_dif >= -1*4 & avg_dif <= 4, 1, 0),           wn_5 = ifelse(avg_dif >= -1*5 & avg_dif <= 5, 1, 0)) %>%     group_by(res_name) %>%   summarise(maxgid = n(),             tot_wn_0 = sum(wn_0)/maxgid*100,             tot_wn_1 = sum(wn_1)/maxgid*100,             tot_wn_2 = sum(wn_2)/maxgid*100,             tot_wn_3 = sum(wn_3)/maxgid*100,             tot_wn_4 = sum(wn_4)/maxgid*100,             tot_wn_5 = sum(wn_5)/maxgid*100) %>%   distinct()

title: sporeg Intended Workflow
text: section, want find results way . Can derive information grid cells tell us contributes better result? First, let’s gather information depth grid cell. example, logged onto National Oceanic Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) ERDDAP server gathered depth information bounding box study site, must geographic coordinate system (e.g., NAD 1983). Let’s get bounding box study site.1 use xmin (Min Longitude), ymin (Min Latitude), xmax (Max Longitude), ymax (Max Latitude) search relevant depth (altitude) data ERDDAP server. going use DatasetID: etopo180  Click graph click Download Data Image Save export. Read depth data. now, load demonstration depth_data file. , also filter depth data depths found inside study site - right now, ’s everything inside grid bounding box. also need re-create grids without false origin.2 study site must projected coordinate system (WGS 84; EPSG: 3857) initially fed function grid_res. Merge depth data different grid cell resolutions. Calculate distance shore, density receivers, presence/absence receivers, merge grid cell depth data. can using false origin shapefiles. Let’s find many grid cells lacked receivers. Merge results grid cell metadata determine grid cells exhibited good fit.
code: load(system.file("extdata", "atlcoast.Rda", package = "sporeg"))   atlcoast <- atlcoast %>%   sf::st_transform(4269) load(system.file("extdata", "depth_data.Rda", package = "sporeg"))  depth_data <- depth_data %>%   sf::st_as_sf(coords = c("longitude", "latitude"), crs = 4269)  depth_data <- sf::st_filter(depth_data, site_depth) %>%    mutate(uid = seq_along(geometry)) site_depth <- site_depth %>%   sf::st_transform(., 3857)  HS_100km_grid <- grid_res(100, site_depth, 4269, "polygons") HS_50km_grid <- grid_res(50, site_depth, 4269, "polygons") HS_25km_grid <- grid_res(25, site_depth, 4269, "polygons") HS_10km_grid <- grid_res(10, site_depth, 4269, "polygons") HS_100km_grid <- depth_data(HS_100km_grid, depth_data) HS_50km_grid <- depth_data(HS_50km_grid, depth_data) HS_25km_grid <- depth_data(HS_25km_grid, depth_data) HS_10km_grid <- depth_data(HS_10km_grid, depth_data) load(system.file("extdata", "fo_sts_pts.Rda", package = "sporeg"))   fo_sts_pts <- fo_sts_pts %>%   sf::st_centroid()  load(system.file("extdata", "fo_study_site.Rda", package = "sporeg"))     load(system.file("extdata", "fo_land_barrier.Rda", package = "sporeg"))   fo_land_barrier <- fo_land_barrier %>%   sf::st_transform(3857) %>%   sf::st_collection_extract('POLYGON') %>%   sf::st_cast('POLYGON') %>%   sf::st_union() %>%   sf::st_as_sf()  epsg = 3857  HS_100km_grid <- merge((HS_100km_grid %>% as.data.frame() %>% dplyr::select(-geometry)), d_shore_rcvs(100, study_site, fo_land_barrier, epsg, fo_sts_pts), by = "gid") %>%   sf::st_as_sf()   HS_50km_grid <- merge((HS_50km_grid %>% as.data.frame %>% dplyr::select(-geometry)), d_shore_rcvs(50, study_site, fo_land_barrier, epsg, fo_sts_pts), by = "gid") %>%   sf::st_as_sf()  HS_25km_grid <- merge((HS_25km_grid %>% as.data.frame %>% dplyr::select(-geometry)), d_shore_rcvs(25, study_site, fo_land_barrier, epsg, fo_sts_pts), by = "gid") %>%   sf::st_as_sf()  HS_10km_grid <- merge((HS_10km_grid %>% as.data.frame %>% dplyr::select(-geometry)), d_shore_rcvs(10, study_site, fo_land_barrier, epsg, fo_sts_pts), by = "gid") %>%   sf::st_as_sf() grids <- list(HS_100km_grid, HS_50km_grid, HS_25km_grid, HS_10km_grid)  grids <- sf::st_as_sf(data.table::rbindlist(grids, idcol = 'resolution')) %>%   left_join(tibble(resolution = 1:4, res_name = c("100km", "50km", "25km", "10km")), by = "resolution") %>%   mutate(res_name = ordered(res_name, levels = c("100km", "50km", "25km", "10km")))  no_rcv <- grids %>%   group_by(res_name) %>%   summarise(n_zeroes = sum(p_a == "0"),             perc_zeroes = n_zeroes/max(gid)*100) %>%   as.data.frame %>%   dplyr::select(-x) results <- results %>%   mutate(g_fit = ifelse(avg_dif>= -1*0.1*anims & avg_dif <= 0.1*anims, 1, 0))  HS_100km_grid <- merge(results %>% dplyr::filter(res_name == "100km"), HS_100km_grid, by = c("gid")) %>%    sf::st_as_sf()   HS_50km_grid <- merge(results %>% dplyr::filter(res_name == "50km"), HS_50km_grid, by = c("gid")) %>%   sf::st_as_sf()   HS_25km_grid <- merge(results %>% dplyr::filter(res_name == "25km"), HS_25km_grid, by = c("gid")) %>%   sf::st_as_sf()   HS_10km_grid <- merge(results %>% dplyr::filter(res_name == "10km"), HS_10km_grid, by = c("gid")) %>%   sf::st_as_sf()

title: sporeg Intended Workflow
text: Let’s marry results sf object lacks false origin can easily map .
code: # Create grids without false origin study_site <- study_site %>% # UTM 17N   sf::st_transform(4269) %>% # Convert to NAD 1983   sf::st_transform(3857) # Convert to WGS 84  HS100km <- grid_res(100, study_site, 3857, "polygons") HS50km <- grid_res(50, study_site, 3857, "polygons") HS25km <- grid_res(25, study_site, 3857, "polygons") HS10km <- grid_res(10, study_site, 3857, "polygons")  # Merge results data to new geometries HS100km <- merge((HS_100km_grid %>% as.data.frame() %>% dplyr::select(-x)), HS100km, by = c("gid")) %>%    sf::st_as_sf()   HS50km <- merge((HS_50km_grid %>% as.data.frame() %>% dplyr::select(-x)), HS50km, by = c("gid")) %>%   sf::st_as_sf()  HS25km <- merge((HS_25km_grid %>% as.data.frame() %>% dplyr::select(-x)), HS25km, by = c("gid")) %>%   sf::st_as_sf()  HS10km <- merge((HS_10km_grid %>% as.data.frame() %>% dplyr::select(-x)), HS10km, by = c("gid")) %>%   sf::st_as_sf()

what: Create a model to test for multicolinearity
title: sporeg Intended Workflow
text: need check multicollinearity main effects see need include interaction terms main effects model.
code: vif.fit <- glm(formula = g_fit ~ den_rcs + p_a + mean_depth + d_shore, family = binomial(), data = HS_10km_grid)  car::vif(vif.fit) #>    den_rcs        p_a mean_depth    d_shore  #>   2.148366   2.143100   3.903303   3.917314

title: sporeg Intended Workflow
text: Now ’ve constructed model using backward selection p-value, let’s evaluate whether useful. ’ll comparing null deviance residual deviance. p-value = 1 - pchisq(null deviance - residual deviance, degrees freedom)

title: sporeg Intended Workflow
text: want know much main effect increases (decreases) odds good fit occurring need calculate odds ratios.
code: odds_100km <- get_or(fit2.100km) %>%   mutate(res_name = "100km")  odds_50km <- get_or(fit3.50km) %>%   mutate(res_name = "50km")  odds_25km <- get_or(fit2.25km) %>%   mutate(res_name = "25km")  odds_10km <- get_or(fit1.10km) %>%   mutate(res_name = "10km")  odds_ratios <- rbind(odds_100km, odds_50km, odds_25km, odds_10km)

what: What if we had chosen a different depth cutoff?
title: sporeg Intended Workflow
text: Blacktip sharks, species chosen demonstrate current methods, known cross Gulf Stream, deep waters, occasion. However, mark recapture study, species caught location depth greater 265 m. cut study 300 m, results change?
code: depth_limit <- 300 # [m]  dif_depth <- lapply(res, dif_co) %>%   data.table::rbindlist(., idcol = 'resolution') %>%   left_join(tibble(resolution = 1:4,                     res_name = c("100km", "50km", "25km", "10km")),              by = "resolution") %>%   mutate(res_name = ordered(res_name, levels = c("100km", "50km", "25km", "10km")))

title: sporeg Intended Workflow
text: Let’s apply methods real acoustic telemetry data can derive distribution information. Now can run movement model, continuous-time correlated random walk model, using momentuHMM R package, impute locations observations. Turn movement model product data frame label predicted locations. Since movement model recognize land, let’s re-route parts crossed land barrier.
code: demo_dets <- momentuHMM::crawlWrap(obsData = demo_dets, timeStep = "15 min",                                     fixPar = c(NA, NA),                                     theta = c(8,0),                                     attempts = 100, retrySD = 5, retryFits = 5,                                     ncores = 2, retryParallel = TRUE)  demo_dets <- data.frame(demo_dets$crwPredict) demo_dets <- demo_dets %>%     dplyr::select(ID, locType, time, mu.x, mu.y, speed) %>%     dplyr::mutate(locType = ifelse(is.na(locType), "p", locType)) %>%  #Specify predicted locs     as.data.frame  demo_dets <- demo_dets %>%     dplyr::select(ID, time, mu.x, mu.y) %>%     dplyr::mutate(time = lubridate::ymd_hms(format(as.POSIXct(time, tz = "UTC"), "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S", ID = as.factor(ID)))) CRS <- 3857  load(system.file("extdata", "atlcoast.Rda", package = "sporeg"))  barrier <- atlcoast %>% sf::st_transform(., 3857) vis_graph <- pathroutr::prt_visgraph(barrier) buffer <- 650    tbuff650 <- sub_rrt(demo_dets, CRS, barrier, vis_graph, buffer)  # Check map mapview::mapView(tbuff650)

code: goodfts_50km <- merge((HS_50km_grid %>% as.data.frame() %>% dplyr::select(-x)), at_line_cts, by = "gid") %>%   sf::st_as_sf()

title: sporeg Intended Workflow
text: Let’s map mean differences corrected map projection.
code: mapview::mapView(goodfts_50km, zcol = "avg_dif")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Mary E. Bowers. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Bowers M (2025). sporeg: package reconstruct sporadic passive tracking data measure bias uncertainty incurred process. R package version 0.1.0, https://mebowers5.github.io/sporeg/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {sporeg: A package to reconstruct sporadic passive tracking data and measure the bias and uncertainty incurred through the process},   author = {Mary E. Bowers},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://mebowers5.github.io/sporeg/}, }

what: A package to reconstruct sporadic passive tracking data and measure the bias and uncertainty incurred through the process
title: A package to reconstruct sporadic passive tracking data and measure the bias and uncertainty incurred through the process
text: goal sporeg reconstruct passive telemetry tracks using movement models measure accuracy reconstructions. provides information reliability ecological conclusions population distribution.

title: A package to reconstruct sporadic passive tracking data and measure the bias and uncertainty incurred through the process
text: Sporeg requires R version >= 4.3.2. latest version sporeg can installed GitHub using following: install sporeg, first install remotes pathroutr packages.
code: install.packages("remotes") library(remotes) remotes::install_github('jmlondon/pathroutr') remotes::install_github('mebowers5/sporeg', build_vignettes = TRUE, dependencies = TRUE)

title: A package to reconstruct sporadic passive tracking data and measure the bias and uncertainty incurred through the process
text: vignette(s) package can accessed via GitHub pages (https://mebowers5.github.io/sporeg/articles/sporeg_workflow.html) following code:
code: browseVignettes(package = "sporeg")

what: Have a suggestion? Found a bug?
title: A package to reconstruct sporadic passive tracking data and measure the bias and uncertainty incurred through the process
text: suggestions problems, please create new issue sporeg GitHub page (https://github.com/mebowers5/sporeg/issues). don’t experience documenting issues GitHub? problem! Start : https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking--work--issues/quickstart.

title: A package to reconstruct sporadic passive tracking data and measure the bias and uncertainty incurred through the process
text: creation package made possible helpful, supportive hosts attendees Ocean Tracking Network Study Hall, particularly Mike O’Brien, Ben Hlina, Jon Pye, Sarah Popova. addition, thank Josh London help pathroutr code encouragement. also thank Brian J. Smith introducing world movement modeling help encouragement early .

title: Summarize receiver density and counts — den_rcvs
code: # Apply den_rcvs to list of grid resolutions  library(sporeg) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(sf) #> Linking to GEOS 3.12.1, GDAL 3.8.4, PROJ 9.4.0; sf_use_s2() is TRUE library(data.table) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘data.table’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:dplyr’: #>  #>     between, first, last load(system.file("extdata", "res.Rda", package = "sporeg"))  rcv_dens <- lapply(res, den_rcvs)  rcv_dens <- data.table::rbindlist(rcv_dens, idcol = 'resolution') %>% left_join(tibble(resolution = 1:4, res_name = c("100km", "50km", "25km", "10km")), by = "resolution") %>% mutate(res_name = ordered(res_name, levels = c("100km", "50km", "25km", "10km")))

text: Different cut

code: dif_co(df, depth_limit)

title: Different cut off — dif_co
text: df data frame object consisting results iterative reconstruction process depth_limit depth value meters represents new depth cut interest

title: Different cut off — dif_co
text: data frame object containing percentage grid cells contained good fit grid cells average depth (mean_depth) less equal depth_limit

title: Different cut off — dif_co
code: # Apply dif_co to list of grid resolutions  library(sporeg) library(dplyr) library(sf) library(data.table) load(system.file("extdata", "res.Rda", package = "sporeg"))  depth_limit <- 300 #[m]  dif_depth <- lapply(res, dif_co) %>% data.table::rbindlist(., idcol = 'resolution') %>% left_join(tibble(resolution = 1:4, res_name = c("100km", "50km", "25km", "10km")), by = "resolution") %>% dplyr::mutate(res_name = ordered(res_name, levels = c("100km", "50km", "25km", "10km")))

title: Good fits summary statistics — gd_fts
code: # Apply gd_fts to list of grid resolutions  library(sporeg) library(dplyr) library(sf) library(data.table)  load(system.file("extdata", "res.Rda", package = "sporeg"))  gd_fit_char <- lapply(res, gd_fts) %>% data.table::rbindlist(., idcol = 'resolution') %>%  left_join(tibble(resolution = 1:4,                   res_name = c("100km", "50km", "25km", "10km")),           by = "resolution") %>%  dplyr::mutate(res_name = ordered(res_name, levels = c("100km", "50km", "25km", "10km")))

title: Create grid — grid_res

title: Create grid — grid_res
code: grid_res(km, study_site, epsg, what)

title: Create grid — grid_res
text: km grid cell resolution km. one-sided length grid cell, assumes desired grid cell squared study_site simple feature polygon object grid cells created epsg epsg numeric code desired coordinate system transformation "polygons" grid cell polygons "centers" center points grid cells

title: Create grid — grid_res
text: grid comprised polygons points depending parameter

title: Create grid — grid_res
code: # NOTE: The study site must be in a projected coordinate system (e.g., WGS 84; EPSG: 3857) # when it is initially fed into the function grid_res  library(sporeg) library(dplyr) library(sf) load(system.file("extdata", "site_depth.Rda", package = "sporeg"))  site_depth <- site_depth %>% sf::st_transform(., 3857) HS_100km_grid <- grid_res(100, site_depth, 4269, "polygons") #> Warning: attribute variables are assumed to be spatially constant throughout all geometries

title: Make a line — make_line
text: functions creates line connecting start end points.

title: Make a line — make_line
code: make_line(start_x, start_y, end_x, end_y)

title: Make a line — make_line
text: start_x longitudinal sf coordinate object desired start point start_y latitudinal sf coordinate object desired start point end_x longitudinal sf coordinate object desired end point end_y latitudinal sf coordinate object desired end point

title: Make a line — make_line
text: simple feature geometry object simple feature linestring object

title: Make a line — make_line
code: library(sporeg) library(dplyr) library(sf) library(purrr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘purrr’ #> The following object is masked from ‘package:data.table’: #>  #>     transpose library(tidyr)  load(system.file("extdata", "at_dly_locs.Rda", package = "sporeg"))  at_lines <- at_dly_locs %>%  dplyr::group_by(ID, time) %>%  sf::st_transform(3857) %>%  dplyr::summarise(pt = sf::st_combine(geometry)) %>%  sf::st_centroid() %>%  dplyr::mutate(lat = sf::st_coordinates(pt)[,2],         lon = sf::st_coordinates(pt)[,1]) %>%  dplyr::arrange(ID, time) %>% #Order data for making lines  dplyr::mutate(start_x = lon, start_y = lat,  end_x = dplyr::lead(lon), end_y = dplyr::lead(lat)) %>%  sf::st_as_sf(coords = c("lon", "lat"), crs = 3857) %>%  dplyr::filter(!is.na(end_y)) %>%  tidyr::nest() %>%  dplyr::mutate(    data = purrr::map(data,                      ~ dplyr::mutate(.x,                               x = purrr::pmap(.l = list(start_x, start_y, end_x, end_y),                                               .f = make_line)))) #> `summarise()` has grouped output by 'ID'. You can override using the `.groups` #> argument.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: See magrittr::%>% details.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
code: lhs %>% rhs

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: result calling rhs(lhs).

title: Run a power analysis — powr
text: wrapper function running power analysis iterative simulation reconstruction methods process.

title: Run a power analysis — powr
code: powr(output, sig.level, power, delta, n)

title: Run a power analysis — powr
text: output resulting data frame iterative methods process sig.level numeric. desired level significance achieve power numeric. desired level power achieve delta numeric. desired effect size achieve n integer. number replicates/sample size. assigned NULL desiring sample size

title: Run a power analysis — powr
text: data frame object

title: Run a power analysis — powr
code: # Use powr wrapper function on example results  library(sporeg) library(dplyr) library(data.table) load(system.file("extdata", "results.Rda", package = "sporeg"))  results <- lapply(results, data.table::rbindlist, idcol = 'resolution') results <- data.table::rbindlist(results, idcol = 'iteration') %>% left_join(tibble(resolution = 1:4, res_name = c("100km", "50km", "25km", "10km")), by = "resolution")  df_var <- zero_var(results) pow_stat <- df_var %>% dplyr::group_by(res_name, gid) %>% dplyr::summarise(sd = sd(dif)) %>% dplyr::ungroup() %>% dplyr::group_by(res_name) #> `summarise()` has grouped output by 'res_name'. You can override using the #> `.groups` argument.  res <- pow_stat %>% dplyr::filter(res_name == "100km")  anims <- 30 power <- 0.8 delta <- anims*0.01 # a delta within 1% of the total number of animals sig.level <- 0.95 n <- NULL  pwr_100km <- powr(res, sig.level, power, delta) print("Grid cell resolution: 100 km x 100 km") #> [1] "Grid cell resolution: 100 km x 100 km" pwr_100km #>  #>      Paired t test power calculation  #>  #>               n = 118.3773 #>           delta = 0.3 #>              sd = 3.609324 #>       sig.level = 0.95 #>           power = 0.8 #>     alternative = two.sided #>  #> NOTE: n is number of *pairs*, sd is std.dev. of *differences* within pairs #>

title: Simulate tracks — simul_trks
text: anims integer. quantity desired animals simulate study_site simple feature polygon object encompasses area tracks allowed simulated. theta argument glatos::crw_in_polygon function vmin numeric. minimum velocity sample step length vmax numeric. maximum velocity sample step length rel_site simple feature polygon object simulated animals "released" simulated tracks begin crs EPSG code study_site polygon. Must projected coordinate system n_days integer. number days tracks simulated initHeading argument glatos::crw_in_polygon function

title: Simulate tracks — simul_trks
text: simple feature (multi)linestring object represents individual simulated tracks

what: sporeg: A package to reconstruct sporadic passive tracking data and measure the bias and uncertainty incurred through the process — sporeg-package
title: sporeg: A package to reconstruct sporadic passive tracking data and measure the bias and uncertainty incurred through the process — sporeg-package
text: package corresponding code Methods Ecology Evolution article, "novel process infer reliability ecological information derived passive acoustic telemetry track reconstruction". intended workflow simulate tracks inside specified polygon, calculate quadrat counts inside grid cells, derive passive detection data simulated tracks using geolocations listening stations, reconstruct tracks using continuous-time correlated random walk models, re-route spurious track intersections specified boundary, calculate quadrat counts reconstructed tracks within grid cells, compare quadrat counts simulated reconstructed tracks. process designed iterated achieve statistical power. user can proceed modeling relationship environmental variables desirable result (.e., good fit) determine environmental variables affect odds good fit grid cells.

title: sporeg: A package to reconstruct sporadic passive tracking data and measure the bias and uncertainty incurred through the process — sporeg-package
text: Maintainer: Mary E. Bowers mebowers5@gmail.com (ORCID)

what: Re-route tracks around a barrier — sub_rrt
title: Re-route tracks around a barrier — sub_rrt
text: function allows re-route demonstrative movement data reconstructed using movement model around polygon barrier.

title: Re-route tracks around a barrier — sub_rrt
code: sub_rrt(track_data, CRS, barrier, vis_graph, buffer)

title: Re-route tracks around a barrier — sub_rrt
text: track_data point location data latitude longitude information CRS epsg code desired coordinate system transformation barrier polygon multipolygon sf object vis_graph vis_graph object created pathroutr::prt_vis_graph function buffer desired buffer size re-routed tracks; generally relate range receivers; distance use units final coordinate system

title: Re-route tracks around a barrier — sub_rrt
text: simple feature (multi)polygon object

title: Re-route tracks around a barrier — sub_rrt
code: library(sporeg) library(dplyr) library(pathroutr) library(sf) load(system.file("extdata", "subset.Rda", package = "sporeg")) load(system.file("extdata", "atlcoast.Rda", package = "sporeg"))  CRS <- 3857 barrier <- atlcoast vis_graph <- pathroutr::prt_visgraph(barrier) #> Warning: repeating attributes for all sub-geometries for which they may not be constant buffer <- 650  tbuff650 <- sub_rrt(subset, CRS, barrier, vis_graph, buffer) #> Warning: x is already of type POLYGON. #> Warning: repeating attributes for all sub-geometries for which they may not be constant

title: Remove zero variance — zero_var
text: function removes grid cells lacked variance.

title: Remove zero variance — zero_var
code: zero_var(df)

title: Remove zero variance — zero_var
text: df data frame object iterative methods results

title: Remove zero variance — zero_var
text: data frame object grid IDs exhibit zero variance

title: Remove zero variance — zero_var
code: # Remove grid cells with zero variance library(sporeg) library(dplyr) load(system.file("extdata", "results.Rda", package = "sporeg"))  results <- lapply(results, data.table::rbindlist, idcol = 'resolution') results <- data.table::rbindlist(results, idcol = 'iteration') results <- results %>% left_join(tibble(resolution = 1:4, res_name = c("100km", "50km", "25km", "10km")), by = "resolution")  df_var <- zero_var(results)
